conditions.solvent: The reaction likely takes place in a polar aprotic solvent such as DMF, DMSO, or acetonitrile to facilitate the SN2 substitution and avoid side reactions.

reactionmetrics.closestliterature: This reaction appears to be an intramolecular SN2 substitution to form a piperidine ring. The alkyl bromide (O=C(N[C@@H]1[C@H](C=2C(CC1)=CC=CC2)C3=CC(OC)=C(Cl)C=C3)CCCCBr) acts as the electrophile, while the tertiary amine (N(CC(OC)OC)(C)[C@@H]1[C@H](C=2C(CC1)=CC=CC2)C3=CC(OC)=C(Cl)C=C3) serves as the nucleophile. The reaction likely proceeds through an SN2 mechanism, with the lone pair of the amine attacking the carbon bearing the bromine, displacing it and forming the new C-N bond to close the piperidine ring.
Williamson ether synthesis
